intro: Rathbunia martinezii, commonly known as the Martinez's rathbunia, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its striking violet to purple flowers and heart-shaped leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in humid tropical environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern.
